clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison Between Bladder Dissection Before and After Uterine Incision in Cesarean Section for Morbidly Adherent Placenta
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Between Bladder Dissection Before and After Uterine Incision in Cesarean Section for Morbidly Adherent Placenta

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison between bladder dissection at the beginning of cesarean section For morbidly adherent placenta and between delaying dissection until planning for cesarean hysterectomy

primary_outcome.time_frame: icluding all cs over the period of one year
icluding all cs over the period of one year
primary_outcome.description: through counting soaked towels and weighting them before and after being soaked considering the difference in grams as the calculated blood loss and calculating blood in the suction reservoir and comparing pre and post operative Hb level also haemotacrit level and number of units of packed RBCs transfused

primary_outcome.time_frame: during cs and post operative delayed complication icluding all cs over the period of one year
primary_outcome.description: - Incidence of urological injuries discovered intraoperative and procedure needed to repair or as a late complication as fistula formation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after delivery of the baby during the 1st 15 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Time taken to create bladder flap
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the start of bladder dissection icluding all cs over the period of one year
secondary_outcome.description: from the start of bladder dissection

intervention.description: Comparison between bladder dissection at the beginning of cesarean section For morbidly adherent placenta and between delaying dissection until planning for cesarean hysterectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Women with BMI at or under 35 Kg/m2.
2. Women having previous two cesarean section or more.
3. Women with gestational age more than 32 weeks with viable fetus.
4. Women with any degree of placenta previa .
5. Patient with morbidly adherent placenta on cesarean scar only.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patient who are haemodynamically unstable before skin incision.
2. Patient with clinically evident intraamniotic infection.
3. Patient with previous history of bladder injury .

responsible_party.investigator_title: Lecturer of obs and gyn atainshams university
